com.github.triceo.splitlog.api

Class LogWatchBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.triceo.splitlog.api.LogWatchBuilder

  • public abstract class LogWatchBuilder
extends Object
    Prepares an instance of LogWatch that will automatically LogWatch.start(). Unless overriden by the user, the instance will have the following properties:
    Reads file from beginning?
    Yes.
    Closes file when the reading is finished?
    No.
    The default interval between each read
    See DEFAULT_DELAY_BETWEEN_READS_IN_MILLISECONDS.
    The buffer size for reading
    See DEFAULT_READ_BUFFER_SIZE_IN_BYTES.
    Default message capacity
    Integer.MAX_VALUE, the maximum possible.
    Interval between two sweeps for unreachable messages.
    See DEFAULT_DELAY_BETWEEN_SWEEPS_IN_MILLISECONDS.
    Interval between requesting tailing and the actual start of tailing.
    By default, the instance will store (and notify of) every message that has passed the getGateCondition() and not do so for all others.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefault

        public static LogWatchBuilder getDefault()
        Used to construct a LogWatch for a particular log file.
        Returns:
        Builder that is used to configure the new log watch instance before using.

      • build

        public abstract LogWatch build()
        Build the log watch with previously defined properties, or defaults where not overriden. Such log watch will not start actually reading #getWatchedFile() until after LogWatch.startFollowing() or MessageProducer.startConsuming(com.github.triceo.splitlog.api.MessageListener) .
        Returns:
        The newly built log watch.

      • buildFollowing

        public abstract Follower buildFollowing()
        Build the log watch with previously defined properties, or defaults where not overriden, and immediately start listening for Messages.
        Returns:
        The follower that will receive the initial messages. The actual LogWatch can be retrieved by Follower.getFollowed().

      • buildFollowingWith

        public abstract Follower buildFollowingWith(TailSplitter splitter)
        Build the log watch with previously defined properties, or defaults where not overriden, and immediately start listening for Messages
        Parameters:
        splitter - The splitter instance to use for the log watch instead of the default.
        Returns:
        The follower that will receive the initial messages. The actual LogWatch can be retrieved by Follower.getFollowed().

      • buildWith

        public abstract LogWatch buildWith(TailSplitter splitter)
        Build the log watch with previously defined properties, or defaults where not overriden. Such log watch will not start actually reading #getWatchedFile() until after LogWatch.startFollowing() or MessageProducer.startConsuming(com.github.triceo.splitlog.api.MessageListener) .
        Parameters:
        splitter - The splitter instance to use for the log watch instead of the default.
        Returns:
        The newly built log watch. This log watch will not start tailing until after LogWatch.startFollowing() or MessageProducer.startConsuming(com.github.triceo.splitlog.api.MessageListener) .

      • withGateCondition

        public LogWatchBuilder withGateCondition(SimpleMessageCondition condition)
        Only the Messages for which SimpleMessageCondition.accept(Message) is true will be passed to Followers and other MessageConsumers. Such Messages will also never be stored. For the purposes of Splitlog, if it fails this condition, it's as if it never existed.
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition.
        Returns:
        This.

      • withReadingBufferSize

        public LogWatchBuilder withReadingBufferSize(int bufferSize)
        Specify the buffer size that will be used for reading changes made to the watched file.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - In bytes.
        Returns:
        This.

      • withStorageCondition

        public LogWatchBuilder withStorageCondition(SimpleMessageCondition condition)
        Only the messages for which SimpleMessageCondition.accept(Message) is true will be stored within the future LogWatch. However, MessageConsumers will be notified of them either way. The condition in question will only ever be called on Messages that have already passed the getGateCondition().
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition.
        Returns:
        This.
